frow.other¶

frow.other.box¶

frow.other.multiprocess¶

class frow.other.multiprocess.PickableFitzDoc(*args, **kwargs)¶

A wrapper that behaves like a fitz doc, but is picklable so can be used with multiprocessing.

Pass it as constructor to frow.tools.pdf.open_ensuring_pdf.

class frow.other.multiprocess.PickableFitzPage(doc_args, doc_kwargs, page_index, doc=None)¶

A wrapper that behaves like a fits page, but is picklable so can be used with multiprocessing.

frow.other.pyfunctional_extensions¶

frow.other.pyfunctional_extensions.distribute(it, n)¶

Distributes the iterator evenly into n iterators.

Parameters

  • it ([type]) – iterator to map on

  • n ([int]) – number of iterators to distribute into

Returns

n-iterators that the iterator was distributed acoross

Return type

[iterator]

frow.other.pyfunctional_extensions.map_with_args_kwargs(it, func, *args, **kwargs)¶

Same as map but passes args and kwargs down to the function

Parameters

  • it ([type]) – iterator to map on

  • func ([type]) – function to map

  • `*args` – args to pass down to function

  • `**kargs` – kwargs to pass down to function

Returns

equivalent to generator `(func(a, *args, **kwargs) for a in a in it)`

Return type

[iterator]

frow.other.pyfunctional_extensions.multiprocessing_map(it, func, pool_size=4, chunksize=128)¶

[summary]

Parameters

  • it ([type]) – iterator to map on

  • func ([type]) – function to map

  • pool_size (int, optional) – Number of workers. Defaults to 4.

  • chunksize (int, optional) – Chunck size passed to workers. Defaults to 128.

Yields

[type] – equivalent to generator `(func(a) for a in a in it)`

frow.other.pyfunctional_extensions.silent_errors(it, logger=None)¶

Prevents errors during iteration from stopping execution. Errors are caught and logged instead.

Parameters

  • it ([type]) – iterator which may raise exceptions

  • logger ([type], optional) – Logger to log to. Defaults to None.

Yields

[type] – yields from the iterator

frow.other.pyfunctional_extensions.star_for_each(it, func)¶

Same as for_each, but *-unpacks inputs

Parameters

  • it ([type]) – iterator to map on

  • func ([type]) – function to map

Returns

equivalent to generator expression `(func(*a) for a in a in it)`

Return type

[iterator]

frow.other.pyfunctional_extensions.starmap_with_args_kwargs(it, func, *args, **kwargs)¶

Same as starmap but passes args and kwargs down to the function

Parameters

  • it ([type]) – iterator to map on

  • func ([type]) – function to map

  • `*args` – args to pass down to function

  • `**kargs` – kwargs to pass down to function

Returns

equivalent to generator `(func(*a, *args, **kwargs) for a in a in it)`

Return type

[iterator]

frow.other.pyfunctional_extensions.with_progress(it, total=None)¶

Allows for iteration with a tqdm progressbar

Parameters

  • it ([type]) – iterator

  • total ([type], optional) – Total number of items in the iterator. Defaults to None.

Yields

[type] – it

frow.other.pyfunctional_extensions.zip_map(it, func)¶

Same as map, but the result is a zip: (a, func(a))

Parameters

  • it ([type]) – iterator to map on

  • func ([type]) – function to map

Returns

equivalent to generator expression `((a, func(a)) for a in a in it)`

Return type

[iterator]

frow.other.pyfunctional_extensions.zip_starmap(it, func)¶

Same as starmap, but the result is a zip: (a, func(*a))

Parameters

  • it ([type]) – iterator to map on

  • func ([type]) – function to map

Returns

equivalent to generator expression `((a, func(*a)) for a in a in it)`

Return type
